roleset.name: prepare, make

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG3
example.text: On Main Street , Alida Verwoerd and her daughters look after the clothes and fabric shop , then hurry home to fix lunch for the rest of the family .
example.arg: for the rest of the family

roleset.note: FIX-V NOTES: Benefactive is Arg3 to maintain mapping from prepare. (from fix.01-v)

roleset.name: repair

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: Banks also want to be able to call someone-1 on the telephone *trace*-1 to fix a problem with a deal that goes bad -- preferably someone other than a union leader.
example.arg: a problem with a deal that goes bad

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: John fixed Mary's car for her.

example.name: thing fixed
example.text: the proposed fixes for what is labeled "program-tradingvolatility"

example.name: With arg m
example.text: a quick fix for a complex problem

roleset.note: FIX-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fix' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class preparing-26.3-1; other framed members include 'prepare'. But that's only one of several senses for 'fix'. (from fix.02-v predicate notes)
FIX-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Comparison to fix.02-V. VN class preparing-26.3-1. Framed by Katie. (from fix.01-n)

roleset.name: establish, set, set location

example.name: the bulk of the financial examples
example.text: ...at an expected premium of 2 1/2% to the closing price when terms-1 are fixed *trace*-1 Tuesday.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: I fixed it all so it short like the email kind of copy short , you know .
example.arg: so it short like the email kind of copy short , you know

example.name: Adjective usage: the game is fixed!
example.text: Now , my grandfather is one of those old , cynical guys that thinks that every sports game that does n't go his way is fixed , and is a tad racest , however , I found the statement intrigueing and made me wonder .
example.arg: every sports game that does n't go his way

example.name: Common finanacial sense, no numbered args
example.text: the best 5 year fix I can find

example.name: With arg 2
example.text: (2) five year fixes at 3.39% fee L 995 or 3.59% fee L 95 plus remortgage costs.
example.arg: 3.39% fee L 995 or 3.59% fee L 95 plus remortgage costs.

example.name: Arg 1
example.text: The mortgage percent fix is at 3.9.

roleset.note: FIX-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fix' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class preparing-26.3-1; other framed members include 'prepare'. But that's only one of several senses for 'fix'. (from fix.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: passive
example.text: Before he left town Pat saw to it that I was fixed [*] up with a job .
